instructions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut meat from rib and shank bones and set aside. Place bones in shallow
pan and roast in oven for about an hour turning at least once. If any meat can be saved from neck bones do it
at about ½ hour. Remove bones from oven and place in an 8-quart pot along with the 3 quarts of water,
onion, celery, green onions with tops and spices. Simmer partially covered for 4 hours. Deglaze the bone
pans with water and add to stockpot. Strain broth, cool and remove excess fat.
Cut meat in 1 inch chunks and brown well in oil in a heavy pan and set aside. Deglaze pan and add to
stockpot.

5 stalks celery, chopped
2 medium onions, chopped
2 cans *(15 oz ea)* tomatoes, cut up
3 cans *(10 oz ea)* bouillon beef stock
2 cans *(14 oz ea)* Swanson beef broth
3 cups water
2 pkg. *(32 oz ea)* Hanover frozen Vegetables for Soup
1/2 cup Quaker quick barley

While bones are simmering, combine browned meat, chopped celery, onions, tomatoes and above liquids
and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Add the two packages of frozen vegetables and barley and continue simmering
for an additional 1/2 hour. Set aside until the broth from bones is ready. Combine the cooked meat and
vegetables with the broth and simmer until the meat and vegetables are tender, probably about 1/2 hour.
Taste for salt. Makes 8 quarts. 
*(Rev. 6/12/92)*
ingredients: 3 1/2 lb crosscuts of beef shank, cut 3/4 inch
(or 1 1/2 lb shank bones and 2 lb chuck)
name: Beef Vegetable Soup
creator: Jim Decker
